22ead532-2d00-46c3-9156-c5828b08691d.title: Digital Home System
22ead532-2d00-46c3-9156-c5828b08691d.original_text: The System allows a web ready computer, cell phone or PDA to control a home's temperature, humidity, lights, security, and the state of small appliances. Users monitor and control home devices and systems. The system equipes with various environmental controllers and sensors. The sensor reads and saved value in the home database. The user read the temperature at a thermostat position. The user set the thermostat temperatures to between 60 ° F and 80 ° F, inclusive, at one degree increments. If a thermostat device allows a user to make a manual temperature setting, the setting remains in effect until the end of the planned or default time period, at which time the planned or default setting will be used for the next time period. The system compatibles with a centralized HVAC (Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning). The system adheres to the standards, policies and procedures of the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air-Conditioning Engineers [ASHRAE 2010]. The user monitor and control a home’s humidity from any location, using a web ready computer, cell phone, or PDA. The user read the humidity at a humidistat position. The user sets the humidity level for a humidistat, from 30% to 60%, inclusive a 1% increments. The system uses wireless signals to communicate, through the master control unit, with the humidistats. The system consists of contact sensors and a set security alarms. The system manages up to fifty door and window contact sensors. The system activates both light and sound alarms one sound alarm and one light alarm subsystem, with multiple lights. The system provides information about the state of a power switch (OFF or ON), indicating the whether an appliance connected to the power switch is OFF or ON. The system changes the state of a power switch (OFF to ON, or ON to OFF), in turn changing the state of an appliance connected to the power switch. If a user changes the state of power switch device manually, the device remains in that state until the end of the planned or default time period, at which time the planned or default setting will be used for the next time period. The system set various preset home parameters (temperature, humidity, security contacts, and on/off appliance/light status) for certain time periods. System provides a monthly planner. The user overrides planned parameter values, through the DH website, or if available, through manual switches on household devices. The system provides a report on the management and control of the home.

ai_result.snl_text:
**Actors Identified:**
- User (using web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA)
- System (includes master control unit, sensors, controllers, alarms, database)
- Thermostat Device
- Humidistat Device
- Power Switch Device

---

**Structured Natural Language (SNL) Requirements:**

1. The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the home’s temperature from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
2. The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the home’s temperature from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
3. The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the home’s humidity from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
4. The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the home’s humidity from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
5. The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the state (ON/OFF) of home lights from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
6. The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the state (ON/OFF) of home lights from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
7. The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the status of home security systems from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
8. The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the state of home security systems from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
9. The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the state (ON/OFF) of small appliances connected to power switches from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
10. The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the state (ON/OFF) of small appliances connected to power switches from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
11. The system shall be able to read environmental values (temperature, humidity, contact sensor status) from all connected sensors.
12. The system shall be able to save all sensor readings in the home database.
13. The system shall provide the User with the ability to read the temperature at a thermostat position.
14. The system shall provide the User with the ability to set the thermostat temperature between 60°F and 80°F, inclusive, in 1°F increments.
15. The system shall validate that thermostat temperature settings are within the range of 60°F to 80°F, inclusive.
16. If the User attempts to set a thermostat temperature outside the allowed range, then the system shall display an error message and prevent the setting.
17. The system shall provide the User with the ability to read the humidity at a humidistat position.
18. The system shall provide the User with the ability to set the humidity level for a humidistat between 30% and 60%, inclusive, in 1% increments.
19. The system shall validate that humidity settings are within the range of 30% to 60%, inclusive.
20. If the User attempts to set a humidity level outside the allowed range, then the system shall display an error message and prevent the setting.
21. The system shall use wireless signals to communicate with all humidistats through the master control unit.
22. The system shall be compatible with centralized HVAC systems.
23. The system shall adhere to the standards, policies, and procedures of ASHRAE 2010.
24. The system shall consist of contact sensors for doors and windows.
25. The system shall be able to manage up to fifty door and window contact sensors.
26. The system shall be able to monitor the open/closed status of each contact sensor.
27. The system shall activate a sound alarm subsystem when a security breach is detected.
28. The system shall activate a light alarm subsystem with multiple lights when a security breach is detected.
29. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view the current state (ON/OFF) of each power switch.
30. The system shall provide the User with the ability to change the state of a power switch from OFF to ON.
31. The system shall provide the User with the ability to change the state of a power switch from ON to OFF.
32. The system shall update the state of the connected appliance when the state of the power switch is changed.
33. If the User changes the state of a power switch manually, then the device shall remain in that state until the end of the planned or default time period.
34. At the end of the planned or default time period, the system shall revert the power switch device to the planned or default setting for the next time period.
35. If the User sets a manual temperature on a thermostat device, then the setting shall remain in effect until the end of the planned or default time period.
36. At the end of the planned or default time period, the system shall apply the planned or default thermostat setting for the next time period.
37. The system shall provide the User with the ability to set preset home parameters (temperature, humidity, security contacts, appliance/light status) for specific time periods.
38. The system shall provide the User with the ability to define time periods for preset home parameters.
39. The system shall provide the User with the ability to override planned parameter values through the DH website.
40. The system shall provide the User with the ability to override planned parameter values through manual switches on household devices, if available.
41. The system shall provide a monthly planner for home parameter scheduling.
42. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view and edit the monthly planner.
43. The system shall notify the User of any failed attempts to set device parameters due to out-of-range values.
44. The system shall notify the User when a device fails to respond to a control command.
45. The system shall provide the User with feedback confirming successful changes to device states.
46. The system shall provide the User with feedback confirming successful saving of preset schedules.
47. The system shall provide the User with a report on the management and control of the home.
48. The system shall allow the User to generate reports for a specified date range.
49. The system shall display all active alarms to the User.
50. The system shall log all manual and scheduled changes to device states in the home database.
51. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view the log of device state changes.
52. The system shall provide the User with the ability to acknowledge and reset alarms.
53. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view the status of all sensors in real time.
54. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view historical sensor data.
55. The system shall provide the User with the ability to configure notification preferences for alarms and device events.
56. The system shall send notifications to the User according to configured preferences when alarms are triggered.
57. The system shall send notifications to the User when scheduled parameter changes are applied.
58. The system shall prevent the User from scheduling overlapping parameter settings for the same device and time period.
59. If the User attempts to schedule overlapping parameter settings, then the system shall display an error message and prevent the scheduling.
60. The system shall provide the User with the ability to delete scheduled parameter settings.
61. The system shall provide the User with the ability to disable scheduled parameter settings.
62. The system shall provide the User with the ability to enable scheduled parameter settings.
63. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view all scheduled parameter settings for all devices.
64. The system shall provide the User with the ability to filter scheduled parameter settings by device, parameter, or time period.
65. The system shall provide the User with the ability to export reports in standard formats (e.g., PDF, CSV).
66. The system shall provide the User with the ability to print reports.
67. The system shall validate all user input for device control and scheduling to ensure data integrity.
68. If a device or sensor becomes unresponsive, then the system shall log the event and notify the User.
69. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view the connectivity status of all devices and sensors.
70. The system shall provide the User with the ability to log out securely from the web interface.
71. The system shall automatically log out the User after a configurable period of inactivity.
72. The system shall provide the User with the ability to change their account password.
73. The system shall encrypt all sensitive data stored in the home database.
74. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view system adherence to ASHRAE 2010 standards in the system documentation.
75. The system shall provide the User with the ability to request technical support through the web interface.

34. At the end of the planned or default time period, the system shall revert the power switch device to the planned or default setting for the next time period.
35. If the User sets a manual temperature on a thermostat device, then the setting shall remain in effect until the end of the planned or default time period.
36. At the end of the planned or default time period, the system shall apply the planned or default thermostat setting for the next time period.
37. The system shall provide the User with the ability to set preset home parameters (temperature, humidity, security contacts, appliance/light status) for specific time periods.
38. The system shall provide the User with the ability to define time periods for preset home parameters.
39. The system shall provide the User with the ability to override planned parameter values through the DH website.
40. The system shall provide the User with the ability to override planned parameter values through manual switches on household devices, if available.
41. The system shall provide a monthly planner for home parameter scheduling.
42. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view and edit the monthly planner.
43. The system shall notify the User of any failed attempts to set device parameters due to out-of-range values.
44. The system shall notify the User when a device fails to respond to a control command.
45. The system shall provide the User with feedback confirming successful changes to device states.
46. The system shall provide the User with feedback confirming successful saving of preset schedules.
47. The system shall provide the User with a report on the management and control of the home.
48. The system shall allow the User to generate reports for a specified date range.
49. The system shall display all active alarms to the User.
50. The system shall log all manual and scheduled changes to device states in the home database.
51. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view the log of device state changes.
52. The system shall provide the User with the ability to acknowledge and reset alarms.
53. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view the status of all sensors in real time.
54. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view historical sensor data.
55. The system shall provide the User with the ability to configure notification preferences for alarms and device events.
56. The system shall send notifications to the User according to configured preferences when alarms are triggered.
57. The system shall send notifications to the User when scheduled parameter changes are applied.
58. The system shall prevent the User from scheduling overlapping parameter settings for the same device and time period.
59. If the User attempts to schedule overlapping parameter settings, then the system shall display an error message and prevent the scheduling.
60. The system shall provide the User with the ability to delete scheduled parameter settings.
61. The system shall provide the User with the ability to disable scheduled parameter settings.
62. The system shall provide the User with the ability to enable scheduled parameter settings.
63. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view all scheduled parameter settings for all devices.
64. The system shall provide the User with the ability to filter scheduled parameter settings by device, parameter, or time period.
65. The system shall provide the User with the ability to export reports in standard formats (e.g., PDF, CSV).
66. The system shall provide the User with the ability to print reports.
67. The system shall validate all user input for device control and scheduling to ensure data integrity.
68. If a device or sensor becomes unresponsive, then the system shall log the event and notify the User.
69. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view the connectivity status of all devices and sensors.
70. The system shall provide the User with the ability to log out securely from the web interface.
71. The system shall automatically log out the User after a configurable period of inactivity.
72. The system shall provide the User with the ability to change their account password.
73. The system shall encrypt all sensitive data stored in the home database.
74. The system shall provide the User with the ability to view system adherence to ASHRAE 2010 standards in the system documentation.
75. The system shall provide the User with the ability to request technical support through the web interface.

ai_requirements:
**Actors Identified:**
- User (using web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA)
- System (includes master control unit, sensors, controllers, alarms, database)
- Thermostat Device
- Humidistat Device
- Power Switch Device

---

**Structured Natural Language (SNL) Requirements:**

1.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the home’s temperature from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the home’s temperature from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the home’s humidity from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the home’s humidity from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the state (ON/OFF) of home lights from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the state (ON/OFF) of home lights from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the status of home security systems from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the state of home security systems from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to monitor the state (ON/OFF) of small appliances connected to power switches from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to control the state (ON/OFF) of small appliances connected to power switches from any location using a web-ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The system shall be able to read environmental values (temperature, humidity, contact sensor status) from all connected sensors.
The system shall be able to save all sensor readings in the home database.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to read the temperature at a thermostat position.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to set the thermostat temperature between 60°F and 80°F, inclusive, in 1°F increments.
The system shall validate that thermostat temperature settings are within the range of 60°F to 80°F, inclusive.
If the User attempts to set a thermostat temperature outside the allowed range, then the system shall display an error message and prevent the setting.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to read the humidity at a humidistat position.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to set the humidity level for a humidistat between 30% and 60%, inclusive, in 1% increments.
The system shall validate that humidity settings are within the range of 30% to 60%, inclusive.
If the User attempts to set a humidity level outside the allowed range, then the system shall display an error message and prevent the setting.
The system shall use wireless signals to communicate with all humidistats through the master control unit.
The system shall be compatible with centralized HVAC systems.
The system shall adhere to the standards, policies, and procedures of ASHRAE 2010.
The system shall consist of contact sensors for doors and windows.
The system shall be able to manage up to fifty door and window contact sensors.
The system shall be able to monitor the open/closed status of each contact sensor.
The system shall activate a sound alarm subsystem when a security breach is detected.
The system shall activate a light alarm subsystem with multiple lights when a security breach is detected.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to view the current state (ON/OFF) of each power switch.

If the User sets a manual temperature on a thermostat device, then the setting shall remain in effect until the end of the planned or default time period.
At the end of the planned or default time period, the system shall apply the planned or default thermostat setting for the next time period.
The system shall provide the User with the ability to set preset home parameters (temperature, humidity, security contacts, appliance/light status) for specific time periods.

items.requirement: The system equips with various environmental controllers and sensors.
items.reason: The AI requirements mention sensors and controllers, but do not explicitly state that the system is equipped with a variety of environmental controllers and sensors, which is a foundational system capability.

items.requirement: The sensor reads and saved value in the home database.
items.reason: While the AI mentions saving sensor readings, it does not specify that the sensor itself reads and saves the value, which may imply a different responsibility split.

missing_in_ai.description: Requirements from original case study that AI failed to capture

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to export reports in standard formats (e.g., PDF, CSV).
items.reason: The original requirements do not mention exporting reports or specific formats, so this is an unnecessary level of detail at this stage.

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to print reports.
items.reason: Printing reports is not mentioned in the original requirements and is an implementation detail that may not be needed for all users.

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to configure notification preferences for alarms and device events.
items.reason: The original requirements only mention notifications in general, not user-configurable preferences, which adds complexity not specified.

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to log out securely from the web interface.
items.reason: Logout and session management are standard security features but are not specified in the original requirements.

items.requirement: The system shall automatically log out the User after a configurable period of inactivity.
items.reason: Automatic logout is a security feature not mentioned in the original requirements and may not be relevant at this level of detail.

items.requirement: The system shall encrypt all sensitive data stored in the home database.
items.reason: Encryption is a security implementation detail not specified in the original requirements.

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to request technical support through the web interface.
items.reason: Technical support features are not mentioned in the original requirements and are outside the scope of the described system functionality.

overspecified_in_ai.description: Requirements where AI was too detailed or specific beyond case study scope

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to override planned parameter values through the DH website.
items.reason: The original requirements do not mention a 'DH website'; this is an assumption or misinterpretation by the AI.

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to override planned parameter values through manual switches on household devices, if available.
items.reason: The original requirements only specify manual settings for thermostats, not for all household devices.

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to set preset home parameters (temperature, humidity, security contacts, appliance/light status) for specific time periods.
items.reason: The original requirements only mention planned or default settings for thermostats, not for all parameters or devices.

items.requirement: The system shall provide the User with the ability to view system adherence to ASHRAE 2010 standards in the system documentation.
items.reason: The original requirements only require adherence to ASHRAE 2010, not that users can view this in documentation.

incorrect_in_ai.description: Requirements where AI made factual errors or misinterpretations

detailed_ai_analysis.analysis_summary: The AI-generated requirements cover most of the original case study's intent but add many features and details not present in the original requirements, such as report exporting, notification preferences, and security/session management. Some requirements are factually incorrect or overgeneralize the original intent (e.g., applying manual overrides or scheduling to all devices). A few foundational system capabilities are not explicitly stated in the AI version. Overall, the AI output is comprehensive but introduces unnecessary complexity and some inaccuracies.
